thinking: The song starts with a strong, simple kick drum beat. Placing a left tap on the first main beat.
Following the kick drum with an alternating right tap for a simple beginner pattern.
Continuing the simple left-right pattern on the main beat.
Placing a right tap on the steady kick drum.
Following the kick drum beat.
Alternating step to keep the rhythm simple and easy to follow.
Matching the consistent downbeat of the kick.
Continuing the simple alternating pattern for the intro.
A new synth melody starts here. I'll begin a slightly different pattern to mark the section change.
Introducing an up arrow to add variety while keeping the rhythm on the main beat.
Moving to a right arrow, following the kick drum.
Using a down arrow to create a simple 'around the pad' feeling.
Repeating the four-step pattern, starting with the left tap.
Continuing the pattern with an up tap on the main beat.
Right tap following the kick.
Down tap to complete the sequence.
The chorus begins with higher energy. Returning to a simple left-right pattern to emphasize the strong beat.
Alternating to the right foot on the main kick drum.
Keeping the chorus pattern simple and powerful.
Following the strong kick beat.
Continuing the left-right alternation through the chorus.
Right tap on the downbeat.
Continuing the simple pattern for the second half of the chorus.
Following the kick with a right tap.
Left tap on the main beat.
Right tap.
The second verse starts. Re-introducing the four-step pattern for variety.
Up arrow to follow the kick.
Right arrow on the beat.
Down arrow to complete the sequence.
Repeating the verse pattern.
Up tap on the kick.
Right tap.
Down tap.
This is a bridge section. Using a simple left-right pattern to match the steady build-up.
Following the consistent kick drum.
Continuing the simple alternating pattern.
Right tap on the downbeat.
Continuing the pattern as the energy builds.
Right tap on the kick.
Left tap.
Right tap.
The main instrumental part returns. Sticking to a simple left-right pattern to follow the main rhythm.
Alternating right tap on the strong kick beat.
Continuing to map the primary kick drum sounds.
Simple right tap.
A fast synth arpeggio starts, but the main kick is still the focus. Placing a left tap on it.
Ignoring the complex melody and following the simple beat.
Left tap on the kick drum.
Right tap.
Continuing the pattern through the final section.
Right tap on the downbeat.
Left tap.
Right tap.
Nearing the end of the song, keeping the pattern consistent.
Right tap on the kick.
Final tap on the last strong beat before the music stops.
